  • Mobile

Feature Chrome Firefox (Gecko) Internet Explorer Opera Safari (WebKit)
Basic support (Supported) (Supported) 9.0 (Supported) (Supported)
Feature Android Firefox Mobile (Gecko) IE Mobile Opera Mobile Safari Mobile
Basic support -- (Supported) ? (Supported) (Supported)
SVGSVGElement.summary: The SVGSVGElement interface provides access to the properties of <svg> elements, as well as methods to manipulate them. This interface contains also various miscellaneous commonly-used utility methods, such as matrix operations and the ability to control the time of redraw on visual rendering devices.

members.name: suspendRedraw
members.help:
Takes a time-out value which indicates that redraw shall not occur until:

  1. the corresponding unsuspendRedraw() call has been made,
  2. an unsuspendRedrawAll() call has been made, or
  3. its timer has timed out.

In environments that do not support interactivity (e.g., print media), then redraw shall not be suspended. Calls to suspendRedraw() and unsuspendRedraw() should, but need not be, made in balanced pairs.

To suspend redraw actions as a collection of SVG DOM changes occur, precede the changes to the SVG DOM with a method call similar to:

suspendHandleID = suspendRedraw(maxWaitMilliseconds);

and follow the changes with a method call similar to:

unsuspendRedraw(suspendHandleID);

Note that multiple suspendRedraw calls can be used at once and that each such method call is treated independently of the other suspendRedraw method calls.

members.name: unsuspendRedraw
members.help: Cancels a specified suspendRedraw() by providing a unique suspend handle ID that was returned by a previous suspendRedraw() call.

members.name: unsuspendRedrawAll
members.help: Cancels all currently active suspendRedraw() method calls. This method is most useful at the very end of a set of SVG DOM calls to ensure that all pending suspendRedraw() method calls have been cancelled.

members.name: forceRedraw
members.help: In rendering environments supporting interactivity, forces the user agent to immediately redraw all regions of the viewport that require updating.

members.name: pauseAnimations
members.help: Suspends (i.e., pauses) all currently running animations that are defined within the SVG document fragment corresponding to this <svg> element, causing the animation clock corresponding to this document fragment to stand still until it is unpaused.

members.name: unpauseAnimations
members.help: Unsuspends (i.e., unpauses) currently running animations that are defined within the SVG document fragment, causing the animation clock to continue from the time at which it was suspended.

members.name: animationsPaused
members.help: Returns true if this SVG document fragment is in a paused state.

members.name: getCurrentTime
members.help: Returns the current time in seconds relative to the start time for the current SVG document fragment. If getCurrentTime is called before the document timeline has begun (for example, by script running in a <script> element before the document's SVGLoad event is dispatched), then 0 is returned.

members.name: setCurrentTime
members.help: Adjusts the clock for this SVG document fragment, establishing a new current time. If setCurrentTime is called before the document timeline has begun (for example, by script running in a <script> element before the document's SVGLoad event is dispatched), then the value of seconds in the last invocation of the method gives the time that the document will seek to once the document timeline has begun.

members.name: getIntersectionList
members.help: Returns the list of graphics elements whose rendered content intersects the supplied rectangle. Each candidate graphics element is to be considered a match only if the same graphics element can be a target of pointer events as defined in pointer-events processing.

members.name: getEnclosureList
members.help: Returns the list of graphics elements whose rendered content is entirely contained within the supplied rectangle. Each candidate graphics element is to be considered a match only if the same graphics element can be a target of pointer events as defined in pointer-events processing.

members.name: checkIntersection
members.help: Returns true if the rendered content of the given element intersects the supplied rectangle. Each candidate graphics element is to be considered a match only if the same graphics element can be a target of pointer events as defined in pointer-events processing.

members.name: checkEnclosure
members.help: Returns true if the rendered content of the given element is entirely contained within the supplied rectangle. Each candidate graphics element is to be considered a match only if the same graphics element can be a target of pointer events as defined in pointer-events processing.

members.name: deselectAll
members.help: Unselects any selected objects, including any selections of text strings and type-in bars.

members.name: createSVGNumber
members.help: Creates an SVGNumber object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to a value of zero.

members.name: createSVGLength
members.help: Creates an SVGLength object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to a value of zero user units.

members.name: createSVGAngle
members.help: Creates an SVGAngle object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to a value of zero degrees (unitless).

members.name: createSVGPoint
members.help: Creates an SVGPoint object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to the point (0,0) in the user coordinate system.

members.name: createSVGMatrix
members.help: Creates an SVGMatrix object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to the identity matrix.

members.name: createSVGRect
members.help: Creates an SVGRect object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized such that all values are set to 0 user units.

members.name: createSVGTransform
members.help: Creates an SVGTransform object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to an identity matrix transform (SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX).

members.name: createSVGTransformFromMatrix
members.help: Creates an SVGTransform object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to the given matrix transform (i.e., SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX). The values from the parameter matrix are copied, the matrix parameter is not adopted as SVGTransform::matrix.

members.name: getElementById
members.help: Searches this SVG document fragment (i.e., the search is restricted to a subset of the document tree) for an Element whose id is given by elementId. If an Element is found, that Element is returned. If no such element exists, returns null. Behavior is not defined if more than one element has this id.

members.name: width
members.help: Corresponds to attribute width on the given <svg> element.

members.name: height
members.help: Corresponds to attribute height on the given <svg> element.

members.name: contentScriptType
members.help: Corresponds to attribute contentScriptType on the given <svg> element.

members.name: contentStyleType
members.help: Corresponds to attribute contentStyleType on the given <svg> element.

members.name: viewport
members.help: The position and size of the viewport (implicit or explicit) that corresponds to this <svg> element. When the browser is actually rendering the content, then the position and size values represent the actual values when rendering. The position and size values are unitless values in the coordinate system of the parent element. If no parent element exists (i.e., <svg> element represents the root of the document tree), if this SVG document is embedded as part of another document (e.g., via the HTML <object> element), then the position and size are unitless values in the coordinate system of the parent document. (If the parent uses CSS or XSL layout, then unitless values represent pixel units for the current CSS or XSL viewport.)

members.name: pixelUnitToMillimeterX
members.help: Size of a pixel units (as defined by CSS2) along the x-axis of the viewport, which represents a unit somewhere in the range of 70dpi to 120dpi, and, on systems that support this, might actually match the characteristics of the target medium. On systems where it is impossible to know the size of a pixel, a suitable default pixel size is provided.

members.name: pixelUnitToMillimeterY
members.help: Corresponding size of a pixel unit along the y-axis of the viewport.

members.name: screenPixelToMillimeterX
members.help: User interface (UI) events in DOM Level 2 indicate the screen positions at which the given UI event occurred. When the browser actually knows the physical size of a "screen unit", this attribute will express that information; otherwise, user agents will provide a suitable default value such as .28mm.

members.name: screenPixelToMillimeterY
members.help: Corresponding size of a screen pixel along the y-axis of the viewport.

members.name: useCurrentView
members.help: The initial view (i.e., before magnification and panning) of the current innermost SVG document fragment can be either the "standard" view (i.e., based on attributes on the <svg> element such as viewBox) or to a "custom" view (i.e., a hyperlink into a particular <view> or other element). If the initial view is the "standard" view, then this attribute is false. If the initial view is a "custom" view, then this attribute is true.

members.name: currentView
members.help:
The definition of the initial view (i.e., before magnification and panning) of the current innermost SVG document fragment. The meaning depends on the situation:
  • If the initial view was a "standard" view, then:
    • the values for viewBox, preserveAspectRatio and zoomAndPan within currentView will match the values for the corresponding DOM attributes that are on SVGSVGElement directly
    • the values for transform and viewTarget within currentView will be null
  • If the initial view was a link into a <view> element, then:
    • the values for viewBox, preserveAspectRatio and zoomAndPan within currentView will correspond to the corresponding attributes for the given <view> element
    • the values for transform and viewTarget within currentView will be null
  • If the initial view was a link into another element (i.e., other than a <view> ), then:
    • the values for viewBox, preserveAspectRatio and zoomAndPan within currentView will match the values for the corresponding DOM attributes that are on SVGSVGElement directly for the closest ancestor <svg> element
    • the values for transform within currentView will be null
    • the viewTarget within currentView will represent the target of the link
  • If the initial view was a link into the SVG document fragment using an SVG view specification fragment identifier (i.e., #svgView(...)), then:
    • the values for viewBox, preserveAspectRatio, zoomAndPan, transform and viewTarget within currentView will correspond to the values from the SVG view specification fragment identifier

members.name: currentTranslate
members.help: On an outermost <svg> element, the corresponding translation factor that takes into account user "magnification".

members.name: currentScale
members.help: On an outermost <svg> element, this attribute indicates the current scale factor relative to the initial view to take into account user magnification and panning operations. DOM attributes currentScale and currentTranslate are equivalent to the 2x3 matrix [a b c d e f] = [currentScale 0 0 currentScale currentTranslate.x currentTranslate.y]. If "magnification" is enabled (i.e., zoomAndPan="magnify"), then the effect is as if an extra transformation were placed at the outermost level on the SVG document fragment (i.e., outside the outermost <svg> element).

SVGPreserveAspectRatio.summary:
The SVGPreserveAspectRatio interface corresponds to the preserveAspectRatio attribute, which is available for some of SVG's elements.

An SVGPreserveAspectRatio object can be designated as read only, which means that attempts to modify the object will result in an exception being thrown.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_UNKNOWN
members.help: The enumeration was set to a value that is not one of predefined types. It is invalid to attempt to define a new value of this type or to attempt to switch an existing value to this type.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_NONE
members.help: Corresponds to value none for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMINYMIN
members.help: Corresponds to value xMinYMin for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMIDYMIN
members.help: Corresponds to value xMidYMin for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMAXYMIN
members.help: Corresponds to value xMaxYMin for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMINYMID
members.help: Corresponds to value xMinYMid for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMIDYMID
members.help: Corresponds to value xMidYMid for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMAXYMID
members.help: Corresponds to value xMaxYMid for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMINYMAX
members.help: Corresponds to value xMinYMax for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMIDYMAX
members.help: Corresponds to value xMidYMax for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_XMAXYMAX
members.help: Corresponds to value xMaxYMax for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_MEETORSLICE_UNKNOWN
members.help: The enumeration was set to a value that is not one of predefined types. It is invalid to attempt to define a new value of this type or to attempt to switch an existing value to this type.

members.name: SVG_MEETORSLICE_MEET
members.help: Corresponds to value meet for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: SVG_MEETORSLICE_SLICE
members.help: Corresponds to value slice for attribute preserveAspectRatio.

members.name: align
members.help: The type of the alignment value as specified by one of the SVG_PRESERVEASPECTRATIO_* constants defined on this interface.

members.name: meetOrSlice
members.help: The type of the meet-or-slice value as specified by one of the SVG_MEETORSLICE_* constants defined on this interface.

WebSocket.seeAlso:
• Writing WebSocket client applications

WebSocket.summary:
This is an experimental feature
Because this feature is still in development in some browsers, check the compatibility table for the proper prefixes to use in various browsers.

The WebSocket object provides the API for creating and managing a WebSocket connection to a server, as well as for sending and receiving data on the connection.

members.name: send
members.help:
Transmits data to the server over the WebSocket connection.

Parameters
data
A text string to send to the server.
Exceptions thrown
INVALID_STATE_ERR
The connection is not currently OPEN.
SYNTAX_ERR
The data is a string that has unpaired surrogates.
Remarks

Gecko 6.0 note
(Firefox 6.0 / Thunderbird 6.0 / SeaMonkey 2.3)

Gecko's implementation of the send() method differs somewhat from the specification in Gecko 6.0; Gecko returns a boolean indicating whether or not the connection is still open (and, by extension, that the data was successfully queued or transmitted); this is corrected in Gecko 8.0 (Firefox 8.0 / Thunderbird 8.0 / SeaMonkey 2.5) . In addition, at this time, Gecko does not support ArrayBuffer or Blob data types.
members.idl:
void send(
  in DOMString data
);

void send(
  in ArrayBuffer data
);

void send(
  in Blob data
);

members.name: close
members.help:
Closes the WebSocket connection or connection attempt, if any. If the connection is already CLOSED, this method does nothing.

Parameters
code Optional
A numeric value indicating the status code explaining why the connection is being closed. If this parameter is not specified, a default value of 1000 (indicating a normal "transaction complete" closure) is assumed. See the list of status codes on the CloseEvent page for permitted values.
reason Optional
A human-readable string explaining why the connection is closing. This string must be no longer than 123 UTF-8 characters.
Exceptions thrown
INVALID_ACCESS_ERR
An invalid code was specified.
SYNTAX_ERR
The reason string is too long or contains unpaired surrogates.
members.idl:
void close(
  in optional unsigned short code,
  in optional DOMString reason
);

members.name: CONNECTING
members.help: The connection is not yet open.

members.name: OPEN
members.help: The connection is open and ready to communicate.

members.name: CLOSING
members.help: The connection is in the process of closing.

members.name: CLOSED
members.help: The connection is closed or couldn't be opened.

members.name: binaryType
members.help: A string indicating the type of binary data being transmitted by the connection. This should be either "blob" if DOM Blob  objects are being used or "arraybuffer" if ArrayBuffer objects are being used.

members.name: bufferedAmount
members.help: The number of bytes of data that have been queued using calls to but not yet transmitted to the network. This value does not reset to zero when the connection is closed; if you keep calling , this will continue to climb. Read only.

members.name: extensions
members.help: The extensions selected by the server. This is currently only the empty string or a list of extensions as negotiated by the connection.

members.name: onclose
members.help: An event listener to be called when the WebSocket connection's readyState changes to CLOSED. The listener receives a CloseEvent named "close".

members.name: onerror
members.help: An event listener to be called when an error occurs. This is a simple event named "error".

members.name: onmessage
members.help: An event listener to be called when a message is received from the server. The listener receives a MessageEvent named "message".

members.name: onopen
members.help: An event listener to be called when the WebSocket connection's readyState changes to OPEN; this indicates that the connection is ready to send and receive data. The event is a simple one with the name "open".

members.name: protocol
members.help: A string indicating the name of the sub-protocol the server selected; this will be one of the strings specified in the protocols parameter when creating the WebSocket object.

members.name: readyState
members.help: The current state of the connection; this is one of the Ready state constants. Read only.

members.name: url
members.help: The URL as resolved by the constructor. This is always an absolute URL. Read only.

members.help: The base value of the given attribute before applying any animations.

members.name: animVal
members.help: If the given attribute or property is being animated, contains the current animated value of the attribute or property. If the given attribute or property is not currently being animated, contains the same value as baseVal.

Worker.title: Worker
Worker.seeAlso:
• Using web workers
  • Functions available to workers
  • Web Workers - W3CWD
  • Web Workers specification - WHATWG
  • SharedWorker
  • ChromeWorker
Worker.summary:
Workers are background tasks that can be easily created and can send messages back to their creators. Creating a worker is as simple as calling the Worker() constructor, specifying a script to be run in the worker thread.

Of note is the fact that workers may in turn spawn new workers as long as those workers are hosted within the same origin as the parent page.  In addition, workers may use XMLHttpRequest for network I/O, with the exception that the responseXML and channel attributes on XMLHttpRequest always return null.

For a list of global functions available to workers, see Functions available to workers.

Gecko 2.0 note
(Firefox 4 / Thunderbird 3.3 / SeaMonkey 2.1)

If you want to use workers in extensions, and would like to have access to js-ctypes, you should use the ChromeWorker object instead.

See Using web workers for examples and details.
Worker.constructor:
The constructor creates a web worker that executes the script at the specified URL. This script must obey the same-origin policy. Note that there is a disagreement among browser manufacturers about whether a data URI is of the same origin or not. Though Gecko 10.0 (Firefox 10.0 / Thunderbird 10.0) and later accept data URIs, that's not the case in all other browsers.

Worker(
  in DOMString aStringURL
);
Parameters
aStringURL
The URL of the script the worker is to execute. It must obey the same-origin policy (or be a data URI for Gecko 10.0 or later).
Return value

A new Worker.

members.name: postMessage
members.help:
Sends a message to the worker's inner scope. This accepts a single parameter, which is the data to send to the worker. The data may be any value or JavaScript object that does not contain functions or cyclical references (since the object is converted to JSON internally).

Parameters
aMessage
The object to deliver to the worker; this will be in the data field in the event delivered to the onmessage handler. This may be any value or JavaScript object that does not contain functions or cyclical references (since the object is converted to JSON internally).
members.idl:
void postMessage(
  in JSObject aMessage
);

members.name: terminate
members.help:
Immediately terminates the worker. This does not offer the worker an opportunity to finish its operations; it is simply stopped at once.

void terminate();

members.name: onmessage
members.help: An event listener that is called whenever a MessageEvent with type message bubbles through the worker. The message is stored in the event's data member.

members.name: onerror
members.help: An event listener that is called whenever an ErrorEvent with type error bubbles through the worker.

HTMLDirectoryElement.title: dir
HTMLDirectoryElement.seeAlso:
• Other list-related HTML Elements: <ol> , <ul> , <li> , <menu> ;
  • CSS properties that may be specially useful to style the <dir> element: 
    • the list-style property, useful to choose the way the ordinal is displayed,
    • CSS counters, useful to handle complex nested lists,
    • the line-height property, useful to simulate the deprecated compact attribute,
    • the margin property, useful to control the indent of the list.

members.name: compact
members.help:
This Boolean attribute hints that the list should be rendered in a compact style. The interpretation of this attribute depends on the user agent and it doesn't work in all browsers.
Usage note: Do not use this attribute, as it has been deprecated: the <dir> element should be styled using CSS. To give a similar effect than the compact attribute, the CSS property line-height can be used with a value of 80%.

SVGAnimationElement.summary: The SVGAnimationElement interface is the base interface for all of the animation element interfaces: SVGAnimateElement , SVGSetElement , SVGAnimateColorElement , SVGAnimateMotionElement and SVGAnimateTransformElement .

members.name: getStartTime
members.help: Returns the begin time, in seconds, for this animation element's current interval, if it exists, regardless of whether the interval has begun yet. If there is no current interval, then a DOMException with code INVALID_STATE_ERR is thrown.

members.name: getCurrentTime

XPathExpression.title: XPathExpression
XPathExpression.summary: An XPathExpression is a compiled XPath query returned from document.createExpression(). It has a method evaluate() which can be used to execute the compiled XPath.

HTMLCollection.title: HTMLCollection
HTMLCollection.compatibility: Different browsers behave differently when there are more than one elements matching the string used as an index (or namedItem's argument). Firefox 8 behaves as specified in DOM 2 and DOM4, returning the first matching element. WebKit browsers and Internet Explorer in this case return another HTMLCollection and Opera returns a NodeList of all matching elements.
HTMLCollection.specification:
• HTML 5, Section 2.7.2, Collections
  • DOM Level 2 HTML, Section 1.4, Miscellaneous Object Definitions
  • DOM4: HTMLCollection
HTMLCollection.summary:
HTMLCollection is an interface representing a generic collection of elements (in document order) and offers methods and properties for traversing the list.

Note: This interface is called HTMLCollection for historical reasons (before DOM4, collections implementing this interface could only have HTML elements as their items).

HTMLCollections in the HTML DOM are live; they are automatically updated when the underlying document is changed.

members.name: item
members.help: Returns the specific node at the given zero-based index into the list. Returns null if the index is out of range.

members.name: namedItem
members.help: Returns the specific node whose ID or, as a fallback, name matches the string specified by name. Matching by name is only done as a last resort, only in HTML, and only if the referenced element supports the name attribute. Returns null if no node exists by the given name.

members.name: length
members.help: The number of items in the collection. Read only.

HTMLFrameElement.title: frame
HTMLFrameElement.summary:
<frame> is an HTML element which defines a particular area in which another HTML document can be displayed. A frame should be used within a <frameset> .

Using the <frame> element is not encouraged because of certain disadvantages such as performance problems and lack of accessibility for users with screen readers. Instead of the <frame> element, <iframe>  may be preferred.

members.name: src
members.help: This attribute is specify document which will be displayed by frame.

members.name: name
members.help: This attribute is used to labeling frames. Without labeling all links will open in the frame that they are in.

members.name: scrolling
members.help: This attribute defines existence of scrollbar. If this attribute is not used, browser put a scrollbar when necessary. There are two choices; "yes" for showing a scrollbar even when it is not necessary and "no" for do not showing a scrollbar even when it is necessary.

members.name: noresize
members.help: This attribute avoid resizing of frames by users.

members.name: marginheight
members.help: This attribute defines how tall the margin between frames will be.

members.name: frameborder
members.help: This attribute allows you to put borders for frames.

members.name: marginwidth
members.help: This attribute defines how wide the margin between frames will be.

There is an additional example available at http://www.mezzoblue.com/archives/20.../counter_intu/. This blog entry was posted on November 01, 2006, but appears to be accurate.
Counter.summary: CSS counters are an implementation of Automatic counters and numbering in CSS 2.1. The value of a counter is manipulated through the use of counter-reset and counter-increment and is displayed on a page using the counter() or counters() function of the content property.

WebKitAnimation.title: CSS animations
examples: Note: The examples here use the -moz- prefix on the animation CSS properties for brevity; the live examples you can click to see in your browser also include the -webkit- prefixed versions.
WebKitAnimation.seeAlso:
• AnimationEvent
  • animation , animation-delay , animation-direction , animation-duration , animation-fill-mode , animation-iteration-count , animation-name , animation-play-state , animation-timing-function , @keyframes
  • Detecting CSS animation support
  • This post from Mozilla hacks, provides two additional examples:
    • http://jsfiddle.net/T88X5/3/light/
    • http://jsfiddle.net/RtvCB/9/light/
WebKitAnimation.summary:
CSS animations make it possible to animate transitions from one CSS style configuration to another. Animations consist of two components: A style describing the animation and a set of keyframes that indicate the start and end states of the animation's CSS style, as well as possible intermediate waypoints along the way.

There are three key advantages to CSS animations over traditional script-driven animation techniques:

  1. They're easy to use for simple animations; you can create them without even having to know JavaScript.
  2. The animations run well, even under moderate system load. Simple animations can often perform poorly in JavaScript (unless they're well made). The rendering engine can use frame-skipping and other techniques to keep the performance as smooth as possible.
  3. Letting the browser control the animation sequence lets the browser optimize performance and efficiency by, for example, reducing the update frequency of animations running in tabs that aren't currently visible.

Event.title: Event
Event.seeAlso:
• Listening to events
  • Listening to events on all tabs
  • Creating and triggering custom events
  • Mouse gesture events
  • Mozilla related events
Event.summary:
This chapter describes the DOM Event Model. The Event interface itself is described, as well as the interfaces for event registration on nodes in the DOM, and event listeners, and several longer examples that show how the various event interfaces relate to one another.

There is an excellent diagram that clearly explains the three phases of event flow through the DOM in the DOM Level 3 Events draft.

members.name: stopPropagation
members.help: Stops the propagation of events further along in the DOM.

members.name: preventDefault
members.help: Cancels the event (if it is cancelable).

members.name: preventCapture
members.help: Obsolete, use event.stopPropagation instead.

members.name: stopImmediatePropagation
members.help: For this particular event, no other listener will be called. Neither those attached on the same element, nor those attached on elements which will be traversed later (in capture phase, for instance)

members.name: preventBubble
members.help: Prevents the event from bubbling. Obsolete, use event.stopPropagation instead.

members.name: initEvent
members.help: Initializes the value of an Event created through the DocumentEvent interface.

members.name: originalTarget
members.help: The original target of the event, before any retargetings (Mozilla-specific).

members.name: timeStamp
members.help: The time that the event was created.

members.name: bubbles
members.help: A boolean indicating whether the event bubbles up through the DOM or not.

members.name: webkitInputSource
members.help: The type of device that generated the event. This is a Gecko-specific value.

members.name: defaultPrevented
members.help: Indicates whether or not event.preventDefault() has been called on the event.

members.name: target
members.help: A reference to the target to which the event was originally dispatched.

members.name: currentTarget
members.help: A reference to the currently registered target for the event.

members.name: isTrusted
members.help: Indicates whether or not the event was initiated by the browser (after a user click for instance) or by a script (using an event creation method, like event.initEvent)

members.name: eventPhase
members.help: Indicates which phase of the event flow is being processed.

members.name: explicitOriginalTarget
members.help: The explicit original target of the event (Mozilla-specific).

members.name: cancelBubble
members.help: A boolean indicating whether the bubbling of the event has been canceled or not.

members.name: cancelable
members.help: A boolean indicating whether the event is cancelable.

members.name: type
members.help: The name of the event (case-insensitive).

SVGTransform.summary:
SVGTransform is the interface for one of the component transformations within an SVGTransformList ; thus, an SVGTransform object corresponds to a single component (e.g., scale(…) or matrix(…)) within a transform attribute.

An SVGTransform object can be designated as read only, which means that attempts to modify the object will result in an exception being thrown.

members.name: setMatrix
members.help:
Sets the transform type to SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX, with parameter matrix defining the new transformation. Note that the values from the parameter matrix are copied.

Exceptions:

  • a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when attempting to modify a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: setTranslate
members.help:
Sets the transform type to SVG_TRANSFORM_TRANSLATE, with parameters tx and ty defining the translation amounts.

Exceptions:

  • a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when attempting to modify a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: setScale
members.help:
Sets the transform type to SVG_TRANSFORM_SCALE, with parameters sx and sy defining the scale amounts.

Exceptions:

  • a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when attempting to modify a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: setRotate
members.help:
Sets the transform type to SVG_TRANSFORM_ROTATE, with parameter angle defining the rotation angle and parameters cx and cy defining the optional center of rotation.

Exceptions:

  • a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when attempting to modify a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: setSkewX
members.help:
Sets the transform type to SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWX, with parameter angle defining the amount of skew.

Exceptions:

  • a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when attempting to modify a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: setSkewY
members.help:
Sets the transform type to SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWY, with parameter angle defining the amount of skew.

Exceptions:

  • a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when attempting to modify a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: SVG_TRANSFORM_UNKNOWN
members.help: The unit type is not one of predefined unit types. It is invalid to attempt to define a new value of this type or to attempt to switch an existing value to this type.

members.name: SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX
members.help: A matrix(…) transformation

members.name: SVG_TRANSFORM_TRANSLATE
members.help: A translate(…) transformation

members.name: SVG_TRANSFORM_SCALE
members.help: A scale(…) transformation

members.name: SVG_ANGLETYPE_ROTATE
members.help: A rotate(…) transformation

members.name: SVG_ANGLETYPE_SKEWX
members.help: A skewx(…) transformation

members.name: SVG_ANGLETYPE_SKEWY
members.help: A skewy(…) transformation

members.name: type
members.help: The type of the value as specified by one of the SVG_TRANSFORM_* constants defined on this interface.

members.name: angle
members.help:
A convenience attribute for SVG_TRANSFORM_ROTATE, SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWX and SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWY. It holds the angle that was specified.

For SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX, SVG_TRANSFORM_TRANSLATE and SVG_TRANSFORM_SCALE, angle will be zero.

members.name: matrix
members.help:
The matrix that represents this transformation. The matrix object is live, meaning that any changes made to the SVGTransform object are immediately reflected in the matrix object and vice versa. In case the matrix object is changed directly (i.e., without using the methods on the SVGTransform interface itself) then the type of the SVGTransform changes to SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX.

  • For SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX, the matrix contains the a, b, c, d, e, f values supplied by the user.
  • For SVG_TRANSFORM_TRANSLATE, e and f represent the translation amounts (a=1, b=0, c=0 and d=1).
  • For SVG_TRANSFORM_SCALE, a and d represent the scale amounts (b=0, c=0, e=0 and f=0).
  • For SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWX and SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWY, a, b, c and d represent the matrix which will result in the given skew (e=0 and f=0).
  • For SVG_TRANSFORM_ROTATE, a, b, c, d, e and f together represent the matrix which will result in the given rotation. When the rotation is around the center point (0, 0), e and f will be zero.

HTMLFormElement.title: HTMLFormElement
examples:
The following example shows how to create a new form element, modify its attributes and submit it.

// Create a form
var f = document.createElement("form");

// Add it to the document body
document.body.appendChild(f);

// Add action and method attributes
f.action = "/cgi-bin/some.cgi";
f.method = "POST"

// Call the form's submit method
f.submit();

In addition, the following complete HTML document shows how to extract information from a form element and to set some of its attributes.

<title>Form example</title>
<script type="text/javascript">
  function getFormInfo() {
    var info;

    // Get a reference using the forms collection
    var f = document.forms["formA"];
    info = "f.elements: " + f.elements + "\n"
         + "f.length: " + f.length + "\n"
         + "f.name: " + f.name + "\n"
         + "f.acceptCharset: " + f.acceptCharset + "\n"
         + "f.action: " + f.action + "\n"
         + "f.enctype: " + f.enctype + "\n"
         + "f.encoding: " + f.encoding + "\n"
         + "f.method: " + f.method + "\n"
         + "f.target: " + f.target;
    document.forms["formA"].elements['tex'].value = info;
  }

  // A reference to the form is passed from the
  // button's onclick attribute using 'this.form'
  function setFormInfo(f) {
    f.method = "GET";
    f.action = "/cgi-bin/evil_executable.cgi";
    f.name   = "totally_new";
  }
</script>

<h1>Form  example</h1>

<form name="formA" id="formA"
 action="/cgi-bin/test" method="POST">
 <p>Click "Info" to see information about the form.
    Click set to change settings, then info again
    to see their effect</p>
 <p>
  <input type="button" value="info"
   onclick="getFormInfo();">
  <input type="button" value="set"
   onclick="setFormInfo(this.form);">
  <input type="reset" value="reset">
  <br>
  <textarea id="tex" style="height:15em; width:20em">
  </textarea>
 </p>
</form>
HTMLFormElement.specification:
HTML 5, Section 4.10.3, The form Element

DOM Level 2 HTML, Section 1.6.5, Object definitions
HTMLFormElement.summary:
FORM elements share all of the properties and methods of other HTML elements described in the element section.

This interface provides methods to create and modify FORM elements using the DOM.

members.name: dispatchFormChange
members.help: Broadcasts form change events. That is, for each item in the elements collection, fire an event named formchange at the item.

members.name: dispatchFormInput
members.help: Broadcasts form input events. That is, for each item in the elements collection, fire an event named forminput at the item.

members.name: item
members.help: Gets the item in the elements collection at the specified index, or null if there is no item at that index. You can also specify the index in array-style brackets or parentheses after the form object name, without calling this method explicitly.

members.name: namedItem
members.help: Gets the item or list of items in elements collection whose name or id match the specified name, or null if no items match. You can also specify the name in array-style brackets or parentheses after the form object name, without calling this method explicitly.

members.name: submit
members.help: Submits the form to the server.

members.name: reset
members.help: Resets the forms to its initial state.

members.name: acceptCharset
members.help: Reflects the accept-charset  HTML attribute, containing a list of character encodings that the server accepts.

members.name: action
members.help: Reflects the action  HTML attribute, containing the URI of a program that processes the information submitted by the form.

members.name: autocomplete
members.help: Reflects the autocomplete HTML attribute, containing a string that indicates whether the controls in this form can have their values automatically populated by the browser.

members.name: elements
members.help: All the form controls belonging to this form element.

members.name: encoding
members.help: Synonym for enctype.

members.name: enctype
members.help: Reflects the enctype  HTML attribute, indicating the type of content that is used to transmit the form to the server. Only specified values can be set.

members.name: length
members.help: The number of controls in the form.

members.name: method
members.help: Reflects the method  HTML attribute, indicating the HTTP method used to submit the form. Only specified values can be set.

members.name: name
members.help: Reflects the name  HTML attribute, containing the name of the form.

members.name: noValidate
members.help: Reflects the novalidate HTML attribute, indicating that the form should not be validated.

members.name: target
members.help: Reflects the target HTML attribute, indicating where to display the results received from submitting the form.

Range.title: range
Range.summary:
The Range object represents a fragment of a document that can contain nodes and parts of text nodes in a given document.

A range can be created using the Document.createRange  method of the Document  object. Range objects can also be retrieved by using the Selection.getRangeAt  method of the Selection  object.

members.name: comparePoint
members.help: Returns -1, 0, or 1 indicating whether the point occurs before, inside, or after the range.

members.name: intersectsNode
members.help: Returns a boolean indicating whether the given node intersects the range.

members.name: selectNode
members.help: Sets the Range to contain the Node  and its contents.

members.name: compareNode
members.help: Returns a constant representing whether the Node is before, after, inside, or surrounding the range.

members.name: setEndAfter
members.help: Sets the end position of a Range relative to another Node .

members.name: setEndBefore
members.help: Sets the end position of a Range relative to another Node .

members.name: extractContents
members.help: Moves contents of a Range from the document tree into a DocumentFragment .

members.name: insertNode
members.help: Insert a Node  at the start of a Range.

members.name: getClientRects
members.help: Returns a list of ClientRect objects that aggregates the results of Element.getClientRects() for all the elements in the range.

members.name: cloneContents
members.help: Returns a DocumentFragment  copying the nodes of a Range.

members.name: deleteContents
members.help: Removes the contents of a Range from the Document .

members.name: compareBoundaryPoints
members.help: Compares the boundary points of two Ranges.

members.name: setStartBefore
members.help: Sets the start position of a Range relative to another Node .

members.name: detach
members.help: Releases Range from use to improve performance.

members.name: getBoundingClientRect
members.help: Returns a ClientRect object which bounds the entire contents of the range; this would be the union of all the rectangles returned by range.getClientRects() .

members.name: isPointInRange
members.help: Returns a boolean indicating whether the given point is in the range.

members.name: selectNodeContents
members.help: Sets the Range to contain the contents of a Node .

members.name: cloneRange
members.help: Returns a Range object with boundary points identical to the cloned Range.

members.name: toString
members.help: Returns the text of the Range

members.name: setStart
members.help: Sets the start position of a Range.

members.name: setStartAfter
members.help: Sets the start position of a Range relative to another Node .

members.name: createContextualFragment
members.help: Returns a DocumentFragment  created from a given string of code.

members.name: setEnd
members.help: Sets the end position of a Range.

members.name: collapse
members.help: Collapses the Range to one of its boundary points.

members.name: surroundContents
members.help: Moves content of a Range into a new Node .

members.name: startOffset
members.help: Returns a number representing where in the startContainer the Range starts.

members.name: startContainer
members.help: Returns the Node  within which the Range starts.

members.name: endOffset
members.help: Returns a number representing where in the endContainer the Range ends.

members.name: collapsed
members.help: Returns a boolean indicating whether the range's start and end points are at the same position.

members.name: endContainer
members.help: Returns the Node  within which the Range ends.

members.name: commonAncestorContainer
members.help: Returns the deepest Node  that contains the startContainer and endContainer Nodes.

HTMLIFrameElement.title: HTMLIFrameElement
HTMLIFrameElement.summary: DOM iframe objects expose the HTMLIFrameElement (or HTML 4 HTMLIFrameElement) interface, which provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular element object interface they also have available to them by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of inline frame elements.

members.name: align
members.help: Specifies the alignment of the frame with respect to the surrounding context.

members.name: contentDocument
members.help: The active document in the inline frame's nested browsing context.

members.name: contentWindow
members.help: The window proxy for the nested browsing context.

members.name: frameborder
members.help: Indicates whether to create borders between frames.

members.name: height
members.help: Reflects the height HTML attribute, indicating the height of the frame.

members.name: longDesc
members.help: URI of a long description of the frame.

members.name: marginHeight
members.help: Height of the frame margin.

members.name: marginWidth
members.help: Width of the frame margin.

members.name: webkitallowfullscreen
members.help: Indicates whether or not the inline frame is willing to be placed into full screen mode. See Using full-screen mode for details.

members.name: name
members.help: Reflects the name HTML attribute, containing a name by which to refer to the frame.

members.name: sandbox
members.help: Reflects the sandbox HTML attribute, indicating extra restrictions on the behavior of the nested content.

members.name: scrolling
members.help: Indicates whether the browser should provide scrollbars for the frame.

members.name: seamless
members.help: Reflects the seamless HTML attribute, indicating that the inline frame should be rendered seamlessly with the parent document.

members.name: src
members.help: Reflects the src HTML attribute, containing the address of the content to be embedded.

members.name: srcdoc
members.help: The content to display in the frame.

members.name: width
members.help: Reflects the width  HTML attribute, indicating the width of the frame.

IDBDatabaseException.summary: In the IndexedDB API, an IDBDatabaseException object represents exception conditions that can be encountered while performing database operations.

members.name: ABORT_ERR
members.help: A request was aborted, for example, through a call to IDBTransaction.abort.

members.name: CONSTRAINT_ERR
members.help: A mutation operation in the transaction failed because a constraint was not satisfied. For example, an object, such as an object store or index, already exists and a request attempted to create a new one.

members.name: DATA_ERR
members.help: Data provided to an operation does not meet requirements.

members.name: NON_TRANSIENT_ERR
members.help: An operation was not allowed on an object. Unless the cause of the error is corrected, retrying the same operation would result in failure.

members.name: NOT_ALLOWED_ERR
members.help:
An operation was called on an object where it is not allowed or at a time when it is not allowed. It also occurs if a request is made on a source object that has been deleted or removed.

More specific variants of this error includes: TRANSACTION_INACTIVE_ERR and READ_ONLY_ERR.

members.name: NOT_FOUND_ERR
members.help: The operation failed, because the requested database object could not be found; for example, an object store did not exist but was being opened.

members.name: QUOTA_ERR
members.help: Either there's not enough remaining storage space or the storage quota was reached and the user declined to give more space to the database.

members.name: READ_ONLY_ERR
members.help: A mutation operation was attempted in a READ_ONLY transaction.

members.name: TIMEOUT_ERR
members.help: A lock for the transaction could not be obtained in a reasonable time.

members.name: TRANSACTION_INACTIVE_ERR
members.help: A request was made against a transaction that is either not currently active or is already finished.

members.name: UNKNOWN_ERR
members.help: The operation failed for reasons unrelated to the database itself, and it is not covered by any other error code; for example, a failure due to disk IO errors.

members.name: VER_ERR
members.help: A request to open a database with a version lower than the one it already has. This can only happen with IDBOpenDBRequest.

members.name: code
members.help: The most appropriate error code for the condition.

members.name: message
members.help: Error message describing the exception raised.

DirectoryEntry.summary:
DRAFT
This page is not complete.

The DirectoryEntry interface of the FileSystem API represents a directory in a file system.

members.name: getFile
members.help:
Creates or looks up a file.

void moveTo (
  (in DOMString path, optional Flags options, optional EntryCallback successCallback, optional ErrorCallback errorCallback);
);
Parameter
path
Either an absolute path or a relative path from this DirectoryEntry to the file to be looked up or created. It is an error to attempt to create a file whose immediate parent does not yet exist.
options
  • If create and exclusive are both true, and the path already exists, getFile must fail.
  • If create is true, the path doesn't exist, and no other error occurs, getFile must create it as a zero-length file and return a corresponding FileEntry.
  • If create is not true and the path doesn't exist, getFile must fail.
  • If create is not true and the path exists, but is a directory, getFile must fail.
  • Otherwise, if no other error occurs, getFile must return a FileEntry corresponding to path.
successCallback
A callback that is called to return the file selected or created.
errorCallback
A callback that is called when errors happen.
Returns
void

members.name: getDirectory
members.help:
Creates or looks up a directory.

void vopyTo (
  (in DOMString path, optional Flags options, optional EntryCallback successCallback, optional ErrorCallback errorCallback);
);
Parameter
path
Either an absolute path or a relative path from this DirectoryEntry to the file to be looked up or created. It is an error to attempt to create a file whose immediate parent does not yet exist.
options
  • If create and exclusive are both true, and the path already exists, getDirectory must fail.
  • If create is true, the path doesn't exist, and no other error occurs, getDirectory must create it as a zero-length file and return a corresponding getDirectory.
  • If create is not true and the path doesn't exist, getDirectory must fail.
  • If create is not true and the path exists, but is a directory, getDirectory must fail.
  • Otherwise, if no other error occurs, getFile must return a getDirectory corresponding to path.

Console.title: Using the Web Console
examples:
Let's say you have a DOM node with the ID "title". In fact, this page you're reading right now has one, so you can open up the Web Console and try this right now.

Let's take a look at the contents of that node by using the $() and inspect() functions:

inspect($("title"))

This automatically opens up the object inspector, showing you the contents of the DOM node with the ID "title".

Let's say you have a DOM node with the ID "title". In fact, this page you're reading right now has one, so you can open up the Web Console and try this right now.

Let's take a look at the contents of that node by using the $() and inspect() functions:

inspect($("title"))

This automatically opens up the object inspector, showing you the contents of the DOM node with the ID "title".

That's well and good if you happen to be sitting at the browser exhibiting some problem, but let's say you're debugging remotely for a user, and need a look at the contents of a node. You can have your user open up the Web Console and dump the contents of the node into the log, then copy and paste it into an email to you, using the pprint() function:

pprint($("title"))

This spews out the contents of the node so you can take a look. Of course, this may be more useful with other objects than a DOM node, but you get the idea.

You can have your user open up the Web Console and dump the contents of the node into the log, then copy and paste it into an email to you, using the pprint() function:

pprint($("title"))

This spews out the contents of the node so you can take a look. Of course, this may be more useful with other objects than a DOM node, but you get the idea.
Console.summary:
Beginning with Firefox 4, the old Error Console has been deprecated in favor of the new, improved Web Console. The Web Console is something of a heads-up display for the web, letting you view error messages and other logged information. In addition, there are methods you can call to output information to the console, making it a useful debugging aid, and you can evaluate JavaScript on the fly.

The Web Console won't replace more advanced debugging tools like Firebug; what it does give you, however, is a way to let remote users of your site or web application gather and report console logs and other information to you. It also provides a lightweight way to debug content if you don't happen to have Firebug installed when something goes wrong.

Note: The Error Console is still available; you can re-enable it by changing the devtools.errorconsole.enabled preference to true and restarting the browser.

Copy an entry to a different location on the file system. You cannot copy an entry inside itself if it is a directory nor can you copy it into its parent if a name different from its current one isn't provided. Directory copies are always recursive—that is, they copy all contents of the directory.

members.name: moveTo
members.help:
Move an entry to a different location on the file system. You cannot do the following:

  • move a directory inside itself or to any child at any depth;
  • move an entry into its parent if a name different from its current one isn't provided;
  • move a file to a path occupied by a directory;
  • move a directory to a path occupied by a file;
  • move any element to a path occupied by a directory which is not empty.

Moving a file over an existing file replaces that existing file. A move of a directory on top of an existing empty directory replaces that directory.

XPathEvaluator.summary:
dom/interfaces/xpath/nsIDOMXPathEvaluator.idlScriptable
This interface is used to evaluate XPath expressions against a DOM node.
Inherits from: nsISupports Last changed in Gecko 1.7

Implemented by: @mozilla.org/dom/xpath-evaluator;1. To create an instance, use:

var domXPathEvaluator = Components.classes["@mozilla.org/dom/xpath-evaluator;1"]
                        .createInstance(Components.interfaces.nsIDOMXPathEvaluator);

members.name: createExpression
members.help:
Creates an nsIDOMXPathExpression which can then be used for (repeated) evaluations.

Gecko 1.9 note
(Firefox 3)

Prior to Gecko 1.9, you could call this method on documents other than the one you planned to run the XPath against; starting with Gecko 1.9, however, you must call it on the same document.

Parameters
expression
A string representing the XPath to be created.
resolver
A name space resolver created by , or a user defined name space resolver. Read more on Implementing a User Defined Namespace Resolver if you wish to take the latter approach.
Return value

An XPath expression, as an nsIDOMXPathExpression object.

   in DOMString expression,
   in nsIDOMXPathNSResolver resolver
 );

members.name: createNSResolver
members.help:
Creates an nsIDOMXPathExpression which resolves name spaces with respect to the definitions in scope for a specified node. It is used to resolve prefixes within the XPath itself, so that they can be matched with the document. null is common for HTML documents or when no name space prefixes are used.

Parameters
nodeResolver
The node to be used as a context for name space resolution.
Return value

A name space resolver.

Parameters

contextNode
A DOM Node to evaluate the XPath expression against. To evaluate against a whole document, use the document.documentElement .

A name space resolver created by , or a user defined name space resolver. Read more on Implementing a User Defined Namespace Resolver if you wish to take the latter approach.

A number that corresponds to one of the type constants of nsIXPathResult .
result
An existing nsIXPathResult to use for the result. Using null will create a new nsIXPathResult .

An XPath result.

FileReaderSync.summary:
The FileReaderSync interface allows to read File or Blob objects in a synchronous way.

This interface is only available in workers as it enables synchronous I/O that could potentially block.

members.name: readAsDataURL
members.help:
This method reads the contents of the specified Blob or File. When the read operation is finished, it returns a data URL representing the file's data. If an error happened during the read, the adequate exception is sent.

Parameters

blob
The DOM Blob or File to read.

Return value

An DOMString representing the file's data as a data URL.

Exceptions

The following exceptions can be raised by this method:

NotFoundError
is raised when the resource represented by the DOM Blob or File cannot be found, e. g. because it has been erased.
SecurityError
is raised when one of the following problematic situation is detected:
  • the resource has been modified by a third party;
  • too many read are performed simultaneously;
  • the file pointed by the resource is unsafe for a use from the Web (like it is a system file).
NotReadableError
is raised when the resource cannot be read due to a permission problem, like a concurrent lock.
EncodingError
is raised when the resource is a data URL and exceed the limit length defined by each browser.
members.idl:
void readAsDataURL(
  in Blob file
);

members.name: readAsText
members.help:
This methods reads the specified blob's contents. When the read operation is finished, it returns a DOMString containing the file represented as a text string. The optional encoding parameter indicates the encoding to be used. If not present, the method will apply a detection algorithm for it. If an error happened during the read, the adequate exception is sent.

Parameters

blob
The DOM Blob or File to read into the DOMString.
encoding
Optional. A string representing the encoding to be used, like iso-8859-1 or UTF-8.

Return value

A DOMString containing the raw binary data from the resource

Exceptions

The following exceptions can be raised by this method:

NotFoundError
is raised when the resource represented by the DOM Blob or File cannot be found, e. g. because it has been erased.
SecurityError
is raised when one of the following problematic situation is detected:
  • the resource has been modified by a third party;
  • two many read are performed simultaneously;
  • the file pointed by the resource is unsafe for a use from the Web (like it is a system file).
NotReadableError
is raised when the resource cannot be read due to a permission problem, like a concurrent lock.
members.idl:
void readAsText(
  in Blob blob,
  in DOMString encoding 
Optional

);

members.name: readAsBinaryString
members.help:
This method reads the contents of the specified Blob, which may be a File. When the read operation is finished, it returns a DOMString containing the raw binary data from the file. If an error happened during the read, the adequate exception is sent.

Note : This method is deprecated and readAsArrayBuffer() should be used instead.

SecurityError
is raised when one of the following problematic situation is detected:
  • the resource has been modified by a third party;
  • two many read are performed simultaneously;
  • the file pointed by the resource is unsafe for a use from the Web (like it is a system file).
NotReadableError
is raised when the resource cannot be read due to a permission problem, like a concurrent lock.
EncodingError
is raised when the resource is a data URL and exceed the limit length defined by each browser.

ValidityState.title: ValidityState
ValidityState.summary: The DOM ValidityState interface represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

members.name: customError
members.help: The element's custom validity message has been set to a non-empty string by calling the element's setCustomValidity() method.

members.name: patternMismatch
members.help: The value does not match the specified pattern .

members.name: rangeOverflow
members.help: The value is greater than the specified max .

members.name: rangeUnderflow
members.help: The value is less than the specified min .

members.name: stepMismatch
members.help: The value does not fit the rules determined by step .

members.name: tooLong
members.help:
The value exceeds the specified maxlength for HTMLInputElement or HTMLTextAreaElement objects.

Note: This will never be true in Gecko, because elements' values are prevented from being longer than maxlength.

members.name: typeMismatch
members.help: The value is not in the required syntax (when type is email or url).

members.name: valid
members.help: No other constraint validation conditions are true.

members.name: valueMissing
members.help: The element has a required attribute, but no value.

CSSStyleDeclaration.title: CSSStyleDeclaration
CSSStyleDeclaration.summary:
A CSSStyleDeclaration is an interface to the declaration block returned by the style property of a cssRule in a stylesheet, when the rule is a CSSStyleRule.

CSSStyleDeclaration is also a read-only interface to the result of getComputedStyle.

members.name: removeProperty
members.help:
Returns the value deleted.
Example: valString= styleObj.removeProperty('color')

members.name: setProperty
members.help:
No return.
Example: styleObj.setProperty('color', 'red', 'important')

members.name: item
members.help:
Returns a property name.
Example: nameString= styleObj.item(0)
Alternative: nameString= styleObj[0]

members.name: getPropertyValue
members.help:
Returns the property value.
Example: valString= styleObj.getPropertyValue('color')

members.name: getPropertyCSSValue
members.help:
Only supported via getComputedStyle.
Returns a CSSValue, or null for Shorthand properties.
Example: cssString= window.getComputedStyle(elem, null).getPropertyCSSValue('color').cssText;
Note: Gecko 1.9 returns null unless using getComputedStyle().
Note: this method may be deprecated by the W3C.

members.name: getPropertyPriority
members.help:
Returns the optional priority, "important".
Example: priString= styleObj.getPropertyPriority('color')

members.name: parentRule
members.help: The containing cssRule.

members.name: cssText
members.help: Textual representation of the declaration block. Setting this attribute changes the style.

members.name: length
members.help: The number of properties. See the item method below.

DeviceMotionEvent.title: DeviceMotionEvent
examples: <coming soon>
DeviceMotionEvent.summary: A DeviceMotionEvent object describes an event that indicates the amount of physical motion of the device that has occurred, and is fired at a set interval (rather than in response to motion). It provides information about the rate of rotation, as well as acceleration along all three axes.

members.name: accelerationIncludingGravity
members.help: The acceleration of the device. This value includes the effect of gravity, and may be the only value available on devices that don't have a gyroscope to allow them to properly remove gravity from the data. Read only.

members.name: interval
members.help: The interval, in milliseconds, at which the DeviceMotionEvent is fired. The next event will be fired in approximately this amount of time.

members.name: acceleration
members.help: The acceleration of the device. This value has taken into account the effect of gravity and removed it from the figures. This value may not exist if the hardware doesn't know how to remove gravity from the acceleration data. Read only.

members.name: rotationRate
members.help: The rates of rotation of the device about all three axes. Read only.

members.name: clientY

members.name: shiftKey

members.name: altKey

members.name: metaKey

members.name: button

members.name: relatedTarget

members.name: webkitPressure

HTMLOptionsCollection.summary: HTMLOptionsCollection is an interface representing a collection of HTML option elements (in document order) and offers methods and properties for traversing the list as well as optionally altering its items. This type is returned solely by the "options" property of select.

members.name: length
members.help: As optionally allowed by the spec, Mozilla allows this property to be set, either removing options at the end when using a shorter length, or adding blank options at the end when setting a longer length. Other implementations could potentially throw a DOMException.

Storage.title: Storage
Storage.seeAlso:
• mozIStorageConnection Database connection to a specific file or in-memory data storage
  • mozIStorageStatement Create and execute SQL statements on a SQLite database.
  • mozIStorageValueArray Wraps an array of SQL values, such as a result row.
  • mozIStorageFunction Create a new SQLite function.
  • mozIStorageAggregateFunction Create a new SQLite aggregate function.
  • mozIStorageProgressHandler Monitor progress during the execution of a statement.
  • mozIStorageStatementWrapper Storage statement wrapper
  • mozIStorageService Storage Service
  • Storage:Performance How to get your database connection performing well.
  • Storage Inspector Extension Makes it easy to view any sqlite database files in the current profile.
  • SQLite Syntax Query language understood by SQLite
  • SQLite Database Browser is a capable free tool available for many platforms. It can be handy for examining existing databases and testing SQL statements.
  • SQLite Manager Extension helps manage sqlite database files on your computer.
Storage.summary:
Storage is a SQLite database API. It is available to trusted callers, meaning extensions and Firefox components only.

The API is currently "unfrozen", which means it is subject to change at any time; in fact, it has changed somewhat with each release of Firefox since it was introduced, and will likely continue to do so for a while.

Note: Storage is not the same as the DOM:Storage feature which can be used by web pages to store persistent data or the Session store API (an XPCOM storage utility for use by extensions).

Attr.title: Attr
Attr.summary:
This type represents a DOM element's attribute as an object. In most DOM methods, you will probably directly retrieve the attribute as a string (e.g., Element.getAttribute() , but certain functions (e.g., Element.getAttributeNode() ) or means of iterating give Attr types.

Warning: In DOM Core 1, 2 and 3, Attr inherited from Node. This is no longer the case in DOM4. In order to bring the implementation of Attr up to specification, work is underway to change it to no longer inherit from Node . You should not be using any Node properties or methods on Attr objects. Starting in Gecko 7.0 (Firefox 7.0 / Thunderbird 7.0 / SeaMonkey 2.4) , the ones that are going to be removed output warning messages to the console. You should revise your code accordingly. See Deprecated properties and methods for a complete list.

members.name: isId
members.help: Indicates whether the attribute is an "ID attribute". An "ID attribute" being an attribute which value is expected to be unique across a DOM Document. In HTML DOM, "id" is the only ID attribute, but XML documents could define others. Whether or not an attribute is unique is often determined by a DTD or other schema description.

members.name: name
members.help: The attribute's name.

members.name: specified
members.help: This property has been deprecated and will be removed in the future; it now always returns true.

DocumentFragment.title: DocumentFragment
DocumentFragment.summary:
DocumentFragment has no properties or methods of its own, but inherits from Node.

A DocumentFragment is a minimal document object that has no parent. It is used as a light-weight version of document to store well-formed or potentially non-well-formed fragments of XML.

See Node for a listing of its properties, constants and methods.

Various other methods can take a document fragment as an argument (e.g., any Node interface methods such as appendChild and insertBefore), in which case the children of the fragment are appended or inserted, not the fragment itself.

SVGLength.summary:
The SVGLength interface correspond to the <length> basic data type.

An SVGLength object can be designated as read only, which means that attempts to modify the object will result in an exception being thrown.

members.name: newValueSpecifiedUnits
members.help:
Reset the value as a number with an associated unitType, thereby replacing the values for all of the attributes on the object.

Exceptions:

  • a DOMException with code NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR is raised if unitType is SVG_LENGTHTYPE_UNKNOWN or not a valid unit type constant (one of the other SVG_LENGTHTYPE_* constants defined on this interface).
  • a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when the length corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: convertToSpecifiedUnits
members.help: Preserve the same underlying stored value, but reset the stored unit identifier to the given unitType. Object attributes unitType, valueInSpecifiedUnits and valueAsString might be modified as a result of this method. For example, if the original value were "0.5cm" and the method was invoked to convert to millimeters, then the unitType would be changed to SVG_LENGTHTYPE_MM, valueInSpecifiedUnits would be changed to the numeric value 5 and valueAsString would be changed to "5mm".

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_UNKNOWN
members.help: The unit type is not one of predefined unit types. It is invalid to attempt to define a new value of this type or to attempt to switch an existing value to this type.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_NUMBER
members.help: No unit type was provided (i.e., a unitless value was specified), which indicates a value in user units.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_PERCENTAGE
members.help: A percentage value was specified.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_EMS
members.help: A value was specified using the em units defined in CSS2.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_EXS
members.help: A value was specified using the ex units defined in CSS2.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_PX
members.help: A value was specified using the px units defined in CSS2.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_CM
members.help: A value was specified using the cm units defined in CSS2.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_MM
members.help: A value was specified using the mm units defined in CSS2.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_IN
members.help: A value was specified using the in units defined in CSS2.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_PT
members.help: A value was specified using the pt units defined in CSS2.

members.name: SVG_LENGTHTYPE_PC
members.help: A value was specified using the pc units defined in CSS2.

members.name: unitType
members.help: The type of the value as specified by one of the SVG_LENGTHTYPE_* constants defined on this interface.

members.name: value
members.help:
The value as a floating point value, in user units. Setting this attribute will cause valueInSpecifiedUnits and valueAsString to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.

Exceptions on setting: a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when the length corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: valueInSpecifiedUnits
members.help:
The value as a floating point value, in the units expressed by unitType. Setting this attribute will cause value and valueAsString to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.

Exceptions on setting: a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when the length corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: valueAsString
members.help:
The value as a string value, in the units expressed by unitType. Setting this attribute will cause value, valueInSpecifiedUnits and unitType to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.

Exceptions on setting:

  • a DOMException with code SYNTAX_ERR is raised if the assigned string cannot be parsed as a valid <length>.
  • a DOMException with code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is raised when the length corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

members.name: canPlayType
members.help: Determines whether the specified media type can be played back.

members.name: load
members.help: Begins loading the media content from the server.

members.name: pause
members.help: Pauses the media playback.

members.name: play
members.help: Begins playback of the media. If you have changed the src attribute of the media element since the page was loaded, you must call load() before play(), otherwise the original media plays again.

members.name: autoplay
members.help: Reflects the autoplay HTML attribute, indicating whether to begin playing as soon as enough media is available.

members.name: buffered
members.help: The ranges of the media source that the browser has buffered, if any.

members.name: controls
members.help: Reflects the controls HTML attribute, indicating whether user interface items for controlling the resource should be displayed.

members.name: currentSrc
members.help: The absolute URL of the chosen media resource (if, for example, the server selects a media file based on the resolution of the user's display), or an empty string if the networkState is EMPTY.

members.name: currentTime
members.help: The current playback time, in seconds.  Setting this value seeks the media to the new time.

members.name: defaultMuted
members.help: Reflects the muted HTML attribute, indicating whether the media element's audio output should be muted by default. Changing the value dynamically will not unmute the audio (it only controls the default state).

members.name: defaultPlaybackRate
members.help: The default playback rate for the media.  The Ogg backend does not support this.  1.0 is "normal speed," values lower than 1.0 make the media play slower than normal, higher values make it play faster.  The value 0.0 is invalid and throws a NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR exception.

members.name: duration
members.help: The length of the media in seconds, or zero if no media data is available.  If the media data is available but the length is unknown, this value is NaN.  If the media is streamed and has no predefined length, the value is Inf.

members.name: ended
members.help: Indicates whether the media element has ended playback.

members.name: error
members.help: The media error object for the most recent error, or null if there has not been an error.

members.name: loop
members.help: Reflects the loop HTML attribute, indicating whether the media element should start over when it reaches the end.

members.name: webkitChannels
members.help: The number of channels in the audio resource (e.g., 2 for stereo).

members.name: webkitFrameBufferLength
members.help: Indicates the number of samples that will be returned in the framebuffer of each MozAudioAvailable event. This number is a total for all channels, and by default is set to be the number of channels * 1024 (e.g., 2 channels * 1024 samples = 2048 total).

members.name: webkitFrameBufferLength
members.help: The mozFrameBufferLength property can be set to a new value, for lower latency, or larger amounts of data, etc. The size given must be a number between 512 and 16384. Using any other size results in an exception being thrown. The best time to set a new length is after the loadedmetadata event fires, when the audio info is known, but before the audio has started or MozAudioAvailable events have begun firing.

members.name: webkitSampleRate
members.help: The number of samples per second that will be played, for example 44100.

members.name: muted
members.help: true if the audio is muted, and false otherwise.

members.name: networkState
members.help:
The current state of fetching the media over the network.

Constant Value Description
EMPTY 0 There is no data yet.  The readyState is also HAVE_NOTHING.
LOADING 1 The media is loading.
LOADED_METADATA 2 The media's metadata has been loaded.
LOADED_FIRST_FRAME 3 The media's first frame has been loaded.
LOADED 4 The media has been fully loaded.

members.name: EMPTY
members.help: There is no data yet.  The readyState is also HAVE_NOTHING.

members.name: LOADING
members.help: The media is loading.

members.name: LOADED_METADATA
members.help: The media's metadata has been loaded.

members.name: LOADED_FIRST_FRAME
members.help: The media's first frame has been loaded.

members.name: LOADED
members.help: The media has been fully loaded.

members.name: paused
members.help: Indicates whether the media element is paused.

members.name: playbackRate
members.help: The current rate at which the media is being played back. This is used to implement user controls for fast forward, slow motion, and so forth. The normal playback rate is multiplied by this value to obtain the current rate, so a value of 1.0 indicates normal speed.  Not supported by the Ogg backend.

members.name: played
members.help: The ranges of the media source that the browser has played, if any.

members.name: preload
members.help: Reflects the preload HTML attribute, indicating what data should be preloaded at page-load time, if any.

members.name: readyState
members.help:
The readiness state of the media:

Constant Value Description
HAVE_NOTHING 0 No information is available about the media resource.
HAVE_METADATA 1 Enough of the media resource has been retrieved that the metadata attributes are initialized.  Seeking will no longer raise an exception.
HAVE_CURRENT_DATA 2 Data is available for the current playback position, but not enough to actually play more than one frame.
HAVE_FUTURE_DATA 3 Data for the current playback position as well as for at least a little bit of time into the future is available (in other words, at least two frames of video, for example).
HAVE_ENOUGH_DATA 4 Enough data is available—and the download rate is high enough—that the media can be played through to the end without interruption.

members.name: HAVE_ENOUGH_DATA
members.help: Enough data is available—and the download rate is high enough—that the media can be played through to the end without interruption.

members.name: seeking

members.name: src

members.name: startTime

members.name: volume
members.help: The audio volume, from 0.0 (silent) to 1.0 (loudest).

members.help: There is no data yet.  The readyState is also HAVE_NOTHING.

members.help: The media is loading.

members.help: The media's metadata has been loaded.

members.help: The media's first frame has been loaded.

members.name: LOADED
members.help: The media has been fully loaded.
